#summary Overview of BigBlueButton 0.81-beta

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

= Introduction =

This document summarizes the major updates in !BigBlueButton 0.81-beta (referred hereafter as 0.81) over the previous release.  For a list of details, see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/list?can=1&q=milestone=Release0.81 issues closed in 0.81-beta].

!BigBlueButton 0.81 represents our eleventh release of !BigBlueButton.   To follow its development, we recommend you subscribe to the [https://groups.google.com/group/bigbluebutton-dev/topics?gvc=2 bigbluebutton-dev] mailing list for updates.


= Major updates =
== Record and Playback ==

!BigBlueButton 0.81 now records and playback all activity in the presentation area (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=1191 1191]).  This includes

  * Mouse movement
  * Whiteboard marks
  * Pan/Zoom

It also records and playback all webcams (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=1326 1326]).  

For more technical details see [081RecordAndPlayback RecordAndPlayback]

== Accessibility ==
This release adds accessibility features for screen readers (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=853 853]).

For the chat module:
  * keyboard navigation
  * Input box focus
  * Screen reader cooperation
  * Audio alerts

For record and playback
  * Thumbnail for labels
  * Access to text from presentation
  * Chat messages

General changes
  * Resize and move windows
  * Hotkey Reference window
  * Localized hotkeys

There is a new 'Shortcuts' dialog that shows you all the keyboard shortcuts.

http://bigbluebutton.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/bbb-images/081/shortcut.png

For more technical details see [081Accessibility Accessibility].

== Whiteboard ==
The whiteboard now has a line tool and text tool (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=591 591]).  

== Layout Manger ==

The New Layout Manager now keeps your windows organized as you resize the browser window.  It also gives you a number of preset layouts to choose from (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=1060 1060]).

http://bigbluebutton.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/bbb-images/081/layout-1.png

For example, on startup !BigBlueButton will use the default layout.  

http://bigbluebutton.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/bbb-images/081/layout-1a.png

You can the switch to a different layout and your windows will automatically resize.

http://bigbluebutton.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/bbb-images/081/layout-1b.png

The layout manager is developer friendly.  You can create a new layout on the screen, save the layout to new_layouts.xml, and then use the new layout to update the contents 


For developers, you can use the Layout Manager to define new layout types.

See [http://www.bigbluebutton.org/2012/11/16/more-updates-to-the-bigbluebutton-ui/ this blog post].


== API Examples ==
=== Browser ID ===

There is an API example showing how to use Mozilla Persona (BrowserID) to let users connect into a !BigBlueButton session (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=1276 1276]).

=== OpenID ===

There is an API example demonstrating how to use OpenID to login to a session (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=1361 1361]).

== IMS Learning Tools Interoperability Support ==

!BigBlueButton will have a new module that implements the IMS Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) standard to enable !BigBlueButton to be a tool provider (see [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=907 907]).

For more technical details see [LTI LTI]
